DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this study is to find out the effects of routinely using different types of pain-relieving strategies during routine immunization injections performed in infants.
DOC.brief_title: Effectiveness of Parent-Led Interventions in Reducing Infant Hypersensitivity to Pain
DOC.criteria: 1. Healthy infants undergoing vaccination. 1. preterm birth (<37 weeks gestation) 2. prior hospitalization/surgery (other than postnatal care), 3. documented/ suspected sensitivity/allergy to amide anaesthetics/vaccines, 4. mother plans to breastfeed or to use topical anesthetics or sugar water during injection.
